definition-item.definition-title: FUNCTIONAL FEATURES OR DETAILS OF LIGHTING DEVICES OR SYSTEMS THEREOF; STRUCTURAL COMBINATIONS OF LIGHTING DEVICES WITH OTHER ARTICLES, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Functional features or details of lighting devices or systems of lighting devices, for example:
Aspects related to light emission or distribution:

list-item.paragraph-text: Reflectors, refractors, light filters, shades, globes, bowls, cover glasses, or other screens, and fastening thereof
Producing or changing characteristics or distribution of the light

section-body.paragraph-text: Aspects not related to light emission or distribution, e.g. fittings:

list-item.paragraph-text: Protecting, supporting, suspending, or attaching arrangements for lighting devices
Arrangements of electric circuit elements in or on lighting devices
Fastening of light sources or lamp holders
Safety devices or cable stowing arrangements structurally associated with lighting devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Lighting devices combined with articles having a primary function unrelated to lighting that are not otherwise provided for.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements of signalling or lighting devices, the mounting or supporting thereof or circuits thereof for vehicles in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storing cable in general
Luminescent materials per se
Candles
Stands for supporting apparatus or articles in general
Safety devices in general
Incandescent bodies heated by combustion. e.g. mantles
Non-electric light sources using luminescence
Light sources using electrochemiluminescence
Light sources using charges of combustible material, e.g. illuminating flash devices
Light sources using semiconductor devices as light generating elements, e.g. using light-emitting diodes [LED] or lasers
Light sources not otherwise provided for
Burners
Optical elements or systems in general
Light guides per se, structural details of arrangements of light guides with other optical elements
Details of light guides adapted for lighting devices or systems
Electric discharge tubes or discharge lamps
Electric incandescent lamps
Masers, lasers
Electric protective circuit arrangements per se
Electric arc lamps
Electroluminescent light sources
Electric light sources using a combination of different types of light generation
Circuit arrangements for light sources
Semiconductor devices specially adapted for light emission
Organic semiconductor devices specially adapted for light emission

section-body.paragraph-text: Structural combinations of lighting devices with other articles are classified in F21V33/00, unless specifically provided for elsewhere in this subclass or elsewhere in the CPC.

Details of non-electric lighting devices or systems are classified in groups F21V35/00 - F21V37/02 only if a special adaptation related to the use of a non-electric light source is of interest. If there is no such special adaption, classification is made in a relevant general place, e.g. in F21V21/00 for suspending arrangements

In this subclass, it is desirable to add the indexing codes of subclass F21W in order to indicate the uses or applications of lighting devices, and of F21Y in order to indicate the form of the light sources of lighting devices.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Light source
The entity (e.g. light bulb, fluorescent tube, gas mantle or combustible charge) that generates light for a lighting device.

definition-item.definition-title: rigid (F21V1/08 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjustable frame of a shade for light source

definition-item.definition-title: foldable or collapsible

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, e.g. shades, globes, refractors, reflectors, filters, screens, grids or protective cages, with provision for shipment or storage

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Controlling the distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of elements

definition-item.definition-title: Rotating shades

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Rotating glass cover or globe or shade or fins due to heat of a light source

definition-item.definition-title: Covers for frames; Frameless shades

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Shades characterised by the material
Stretched fly attached to a ceiling frame
A stretched fly attached to a ceiling frame

definition-item.definition-title: Globes; Bowls; Cover glasses (with refracting properties F21V5/00; with reflecting properties F21V7/00; characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/506)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Globes for street lighting devices
Glass cover for automotive vehicles
Globes, bowls, cover glasses characterised by their shapes
Globes, bowls, cover glasses characterised by material, coatings or surface treatments
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: With refracting properties
With reflecting properties

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Transparent cover plates for vehicle headlamps and rear lamps

definition-item.definition-title: Refractors for light sources (characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/504)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cooling arrangements for refractors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combinations of only two kinds of elements being reflectors and refractors
Combinations of only three kinds of elements being reflectors, refractors, and filters
Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of parts by movement of refractors
Producing optical elements, e.g. lenses, prisms (grinding or polishing of optical elements B24B; constructional form of optical elements G02B; optical parts of spectacles G02C7/00)
Refractors for vehicle headlamps and rear lamps
Optical elements

definition-item.definition-title: {Array of lenses or refractors for a cluster of light sources, e.g. for arrangement of multiple light sources in one plane (combination of two or more refractors F21V5/008)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combination of two or more refractors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Simple or compound lenses; Arrays

definition-item.definition-title: of prismatic shape (F21V5/04 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Refractor of lens shape

definition-item.definition-title: of lens shape

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Simple or compound lenses
Optical system adapting the beam shape of a semiconductor light source such as a laser diode or an LED, e.g. for efficiently coupling into optical fibres

definition-item.definition-title: {the lens having discontinuous faces, e.g. Fresnel lenses}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Simple or compound lenses with non-spherical faces with discontinuous faces, e.g. Fresnel lens

definition-item.definition-title: {the lens having a rotationally symmetrical shape about an axis for transmitting light in a direction mainly perpendicular to this axis, e.g. ring or annular lens with light source disposed inside the ring}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {the lens being a simple lens adapted to cooperate with a point-like source for emitting mainly in one direction and having an axis coincident with the main light transmission direction, e.g. convergent or divergent lenses, plano-concave or plano-convex lenses}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: producing an asymmetric light distribution

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Reflectors for light sources (characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/505)

section-body.paragraph-text: In the context of lighting, a "reflector" is a device which reflects light with desired characteristics and distribution, while a "filter" is a device which passes light with desired characteristics and distribution.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combinations of two kinds of elements one being of reflector and one of the following: refractor, filter or screen
Combinations of three kinds of elements being reflectors, refractors, and filters
Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of parts by movement of reflectors
Reflectors for vehicle headlamps or rear lamps
Optical elements other than lenses: Mirrors
System with reflecting surfaces using mirrors only, for light condensing, e.g. for use with a light emitter
Systems with reflecting surfaces, with or without refracting elements for light condensing, e.g. for use with a light emitter
Projectors or projection-type viewers: Reflectors in projection beam

definition-item.definition-title: {providing for indirect lighting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The lighting devices emitting light towards the ceiling and not toward the surface of interest to be lit
Lighting devices, the light beams of which are not being directed directly toward the aim, e.g. by means of reflectors
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Combination of two or more reflectors for a single light source (array of reflectors for a cluster of light sources F21V7/0083)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Array of reflectors for a cluster of light sources

definition-item.definition-title: {with an elongated shape to cooperate with linear light sources}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Elongated reflective surface with its axis parallel to the axis of an elongated light emitter.
Plurality of reflective surfaces along an axis parallel to the axis of one elongated light emitter.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Plurality of reflective surfaces along an axis parallel to the axis of an light source formed of a plurality of light emitters, each light emitter corresponding to an individual reflective surface, i.e. array of light sources

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of F21Y2103/00

definition-item.definition-title: {adapted to cooperate with light sources of shapes different from point-like or linear, e.g. circular light sources}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of F21Y2103/30

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted to cooperate with point like light sources; specially adapted to cooperate with light sources the shape of which is unspecified (F21V7/16 - F21V7/30 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Construction of reflector with provision for adjusting the curvature
Construction of reflector with provision for folding or collapsing
Reflectors characterised by materials, surface treatments or coatings, e.g. dichroic reflectors
Reflector constructed to facilitate cooling

definition-item.definition-title: {Array of reflectors for a cluster of light sources, e.g. arrangement of multiple light sources in one plane (combination of two or more reflectors F21V7/0025)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Plurality of individually removable identical reflectors on a planar matrix of LEDs
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combination of two or more reflectors for a single light source

definition-item.definition-title: {using total internal reflection}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reflectors for rear vehicle light using total internal reflection.
Refractors having surfaces used for total internal reflection.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reflectors for vehicle headlamps using total internal reflection

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems with reflecting surfaces, with or without refracting elements; Catadioptric systems for use with light emitter

section-body.paragraph-text: Reflectors for signal lamps for vehicles using total internal reflection have to be also classified in F21S43/315.
Collimators for signal lamps for vehicles using total internal reflection have to be also classified in F21S43/402.
Refractors having surfaces used for total internal reflection have to be also classified in F21V5/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Optical design

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reflector for which the surface is defined by mathematical formulae.

definition-item.definition-title: with a combination of different curvatures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Also reflector surfaces with asperities

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for folding or collapsing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by materials, surface treatments or coatings, e.g. dichroic reflectors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Surface treatment of glass, at least one coating being a metal
Multilayer mirrors

definition-item.definition-title: Elements for modifying spectral properties, polarisation or intensity of the light emitted, e.g. filters (coloured shades F21V1/00; elements characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/502)

section-body.paragraph-text: In the context of lighting, a "filter" is a device which passes light with desired characteristics and distribution, while a "reflector" is a device which reflects light with desired characteristics and distribution.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coloured shades
Cooling arrangements for light filters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combination of only two kinds of elements being reflectors and filters
Combination of only three kinds of elements being reflectors, refractors and filters
Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of parts by movement of screens
Luminescent materials per se
Filters for vehicle headlamps or rear lamps

definition-item.definition-title: for simulating daylight (F21V9/04, F21V9/06 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
False windows are also covered by this subgroup
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Light filters for filtering out infrared radiation
Light filters for filtering out ultraviolet radiation

definition-item.definition-title: for filtering out infrared radiation (dichroic reflectors F21V7/22; using liquid-filled chambers F21V9/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dichroic reflectors
Light filters for producing coloured light with liquid-filled chambers

definition-item.definition-title: for filtering out ultraviolet radiation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Elements containing photoluminescent material distinct from or spaced from the light source

definition-item.definition-title: for producing coloured light, e.g. monochromatic; for reducing intensity of light (with provision for controlling the colour F21V9/40)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Elements with provision for controlling spectral properties, e.g. colour, or intensity

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Radiation therapy using light characterised by the wavelength of light used; Coloured visible light

definition-item.definition-title: Elements containing photoluminescent material distinct from or spaced from the light source (shades F21V1/17; globes, bowls or cover glasses F21V3/08, F21V3/12; refractors F21V5/10; reflectors F21V7/26, F21V7/30; elements with provision for controlling the spectral properties or intensity F21V9/40)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shades containing photoluminescent material
Globes, bowls or cover glasses containing photoluminescent material
Refractors containing photoluminescent material
Reflectors containing photoluminescent material
Elements with provision for controlling the spectral properties or intensity containing photoluminescent material

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for controlling spectral properties, e.g. colour, or intensity

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Light filters for producing coloured light with liquid-filled chambers

definition-item.definition-title: Screens not covered by groups F21V1/00, F21V3/00, F21V7/00 or F21V9/00 (characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/502)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cooling arrangements for screens not covered by groups

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combination of only two kinds of elements being reflectors and screens
Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of parts by movement of screens
Screens, light shielding members for vehicle headlamps

definition-item.definition-title: using parallel laminae or strips, e.g. of Venetian-blind type (F21V11/06 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Screens using crossed laminae or strips

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Adjustable lamellae
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light by movement of screens

definition-item.definition-title: using crossed laminae or strips {, e.g. grid-shaped louvers}; using lattices or honeycombs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: with many small apertures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Polymeric light control film with holes on an elongated light source

definition-item.definition-title: using sheets without apertures, e.g. fixed

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Screens using parallel laminae or strips
Screens using crossed laminae or strips

definition-item.definition-title: movable, e.g. flaps, slides

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
Light-shielding plates for stage projectors

definition-item.definition-title: Producing particular characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by means of a combination of elements specified in two or more of main groups F21V1/00 - F21V11/00 (controlling the distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of elements F21V14/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Producing particular characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by means of a combination of two or more elements that are all specified in a single of main groups F21V1/00 - F21V11/00 is classified in that main group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Controlling the distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: By means of a combination of reflectors and refractors for vehicle rear lamps

definition-item.definition-title: Combinations of only two kinds of elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems with reflecting surfaces, with or without refracting elements for light condensing, e.g. for use with a light emitter

definition-item.definition-title: the elements being filters or photoluminescent elements, reflectors and refractors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Controlling the distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of elements (reflectors with provision for adjusting the curvature F21V7/16; light filters or the like with provision for controlling the colour or intensity F21V9/40; screens using adjustable parallel laminae or strips F21V11/04; screens using iris-type diaphragms F21V11/10; screens using movable sheets without apertures F21V11/18; adjustable mountings for lighting devices F21V21/14)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reflectors with provision for adjusting the curvature
Light filters or the like with provision for controlling the colour or intensity
Screens using adjustable parallel laminae or strips
Screens using iris-type diaphragms
Screens using movable sheets without apertures
Adjustable mountings for lighting devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment of components of the lighting device
Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment of the lamp holder or the light source
Adjustable vehicle headlamp housing

section-body.paragraph-text: Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment of components of the lighting device F21V17/02, it is the desirable to give the Indexing Code of F21V14/04, F21V14/06 or F21V14/08
Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment of the lamp holder or the light source F21V19/02, it is then desirable to give the Indexing Code F21V14/02

definition-item.definition-title: {by interposition of elements with electrically controlled variable light transmissivity, e.g. liquid crystal elements or electrochromic devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: In vehicle headlamps

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Liquid crystal elements

definition-item.definition-title: by movement of the screens {or filters}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Changing characteristic or distribution of light by movement of screens or filters
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjustable lamellae
Movable screens being sheets without apertures
In vehicle headlamps

definition-item.definition-title: Protecting lighting devices from damage (protection from thermal damage F21V29/00; gas-tight or water-tight arrangements F21V31/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Protecting lighting devices from damage due to external interactions, e.g. anti-vandalism devices, cages
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protecting lighting devices from thermal damage
Gas-tight or water-tight arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: Housings, e.g. material or assembling of housing parts (F21V15/02 takes precedence {housings forming signs or letters G09F13/04})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cages for protecting lighting devices from damage
Housings forming signs or letters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lighting device essentially made of an elongated section for suspending at least one linear light source
Casings, cabinets or drawers for electric apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {the housing being an extrusion}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lighting devices or systems using a string or strip of light sources

definition-item.definition-title: Cages

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Resilient mountings, e.g. shock absorbers {(shock absorbing devices of vehicle headlamp housings B60Q1/0491; in general F16F15/04)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shock absorbing devices of headlamp housings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of lighting devices employing liquid fuel as light source, not otherwise provided for; Fastening or safety devices for reflectors, cover glasses or chimneys; Protections against shocks
Shock absorbing devices in general

definition-item.definition-title: Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, e.g. shades, globes, refractors, reflectors, filters, screens, grids or protective cages (of light sources or light holders F21V19/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of light sources or light holders

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening or lifting of the lamp glass of lanterns
Fastening of component parts of vehicle headlamps
Fastening of component parts of vehicle signal lamps

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For gas-tight or water-tight arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {with provision for shipment or storage}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Components of lighting devices intended to be easily dismounted or with reduced dismounted volume for shipment or storage
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Foldable or collapsible frames for shades for light sources
Construction of reflector with provision for folding or collapsing
Receptacles with Roll-up holders with pockets for separates articles (personal use); Not limited to lamps
Machines, apparatus or devices for or method of packaging or material; unpacking
Packaging for ampoules, lamp bulbs (for sale)
Packaging for ampoules or lamp bulbs, e.g. for sale
Supports or holders for coiled, wound or folded material

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for adjustment (F21V17/04 - F21V17/08 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, the fastening being onto or by the light source
Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, the fastening being onto or by the lampholder
Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, onto the supporting or suspending arrangements of the lighting device, e.g. power cords, standards

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Controlling the distribution of the light emitted by adjustment of elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Always provide also the information which component is concerned by giving the relevant Indexing Code F21V5/00-F21V9/00; if the focus is on the change in the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted give also additional information symbols in groups F21V14/04-F21V14/08

definition-item.definition-title: the fastening being onto or by the light source

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: the fastening being onto or by the lampholder

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electric light-globe holder
Outer shell structure of a decoration lamp string

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by specific fastening means or way of fastening (F21V17/02 - F21V17/08 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of component parts of lighting devices with provision for adjustment
Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, the fastening being onto or by the light source
Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, the fastening being onto or by the lampholder
Fastening of component parts of lighting devices, onto the supporting or suspending arrangements of the lighting device, e.g. power cords, standards

definition-item.definition-title: {permanently, e.g. welding, gluing or riveting}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joining or sealing of preformed parts, welding of plastics materials
Joining sheets or plates, e.g. panels, to one another or to strips or bars parallel to them by means of riveting

definition-item.definition-title: Fastening of light sources or lamp holders (fastening electric light source solely by the coupling device H01R33/00 {; special means for attaching candle to candle holder F21V35/003})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special means for attaching the candle to the candle holder
Fastening electric light sources in vehicle headlamps
Fastening electric light sources in vehicle signal lamps
Fastening electric light source solely by the coupling device

definition-item.definition-title: {of sources having contact pins, wires or blades, e.g. pinch sealed lamp (F21V19/001 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of removably mounted LEDs; Fastening of removably mounted PCBs holding light sources

definition-item.definition-title: {the light sources being semiconductors devices, e.g. LEDs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of light sources or lampholders: Details of lamp holders, terminals or connectors for vehicle headlamps
Fastening of light sources or lampholders: Details of lamp holders, terminals or connectors for vehicle rear lights

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed circuits structurally associated with non-printed electric components characterised by the use of a flexible or folded printed circuit

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: PCB
Printed Circuit Board
LED
Light Emitting Diode

definition-item.definition-title: {of point-like light sources, e.g. incandescent or halogen lamps, with screw-threaded or bayonet base (of sources having contact pins, wires or blades F21V19/0005; of LEDs or sources mounted on printed-circuit board F21V19/001)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of light sources or lampholders of sources having contact pins, wires or blades
Fastening of removably mounted LEDs; Fastening of removably mounted PCBs holding light sources

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: LED
Light Emitting Diode

definition-item.definition-title: {of tubular light sources, e.g. ring-shaped fluorescent light sources}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Holders formed as intermediate parts for linking a counter-part to a coupling part for tubular fluorescent lamps

definition-item.definition-title: {at least one conductive element acting as a support means, e.g. resilient contact blades, piston-like contact}

section-body.paragraph-text: This group does not cover coupling devices in which a holder is adapted for supporting apparatus to which its counterpart is attached or separate parts thereof, see H01R33/08: Two-pole devices for supporting tubular fluorescent lamps.

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for adjustment, e.g. for focusing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details regarding the mechanism for the adjustment of the light source or lampholder
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Changing the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted by movement of light sources

section-body.paragraph-text: If the focus is on the change in the characteristics or distribution of the light emitted give also F21V14/02

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for changing light source, e.g. turret {(auxiliary devices for cleaning, placing, or removing incandescent lamps H01K3/32, fluorescent lamps H01J9/006)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary devices for cleaning, placing, or removing fluorescent lamps
Auxiliary devices for cleaning, placing, or removing incandescent lamps

definition-item.definition-title: Supporting, suspending, or attaching arrangements for lighting devices (F21V17/00, F21V19/00 take precedence; arrangement of signalling or lighting devices, the mounting or supporting thereof or circuits therefor, for vehicles in general B60Q, stands for supporting apparatus or articles in general F16M11/00); Hand grips

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of component parts of lighting devices
Fastening of light sources or lampholders

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangement of signalling or lighting devices, the mounting or supporting thereof or circuits therefor, for vehicles in general
Stands for supporting apparatus or articles in general

definition-item.definition-title: making direct electrical contact, e.g. by piercing (F21V21/35 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The housing of the lighting device or lampholder is equipped with needle contacts to pierce the cable insulator to connect while attaching the housing or lampholder to the cable.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supporting elements displaceable along a guiding element with direct electrical contact between the supporting element and electric conductors running along the guiding element

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electrically-conductive connections between two or more conductive members in direct contact and means for effecting or maintaining such contact; Needle-point, slotted plate, or analogous contact members penetrating insulation or cable strands having at least one tooth, prong, pin or needle penetrating the insulation

definition-item.definition-title: for several lighting devices in an end-to-end arrangement, i.e. light tracks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Housing of lighting devices mechanically in side-by-side or end-to-end contact
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Systems of lighting devices, not provided for in main groups F21S4/00 - F21S10/00 or F21S19/00
Lighting devices or systems

definition-item.definition-title: Suspending from a cable or suspension line

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details of the suspending means from a cable or suspension line
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lighting devices intended for fixed installation intended only for mounting on a ceiling or like overhead structure

definition-item.definition-title: Wall, ceiling, or floor bases; Fixing pendants or arms to the bases (F21V21/08 takes precedence; bases for movable standing lamps F21V21/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supporting, suspending, or attaching arrangements for lighting devices; Devices for easy attachment to any desired place, e.g. clip, clamp, magnet

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bases for movable standing lamps
Installation of electrical cables or lines in buildings / Details / Distribution boxes / ceiling roses or other lighting sets

definition-item.definition-title: Ceiling bases, e.g. ceiling roses (F21V21/04 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Recessed bases

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details of the fastening means for a recessed lighting device
Hanger bar for recessed lighting fixtures
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for fixing loudspeaker transducers, e.g. in a box, furniture

section-body.paragraph-text: Generally no classification in F21S8/02

definition-item.definition-title: Bases for movable standing lamps; Fixing standards to the bases (F21V21/08 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Portable lighting devices provided with stands or bases to be used as a movable standing lamp
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supporting, suspending, or attaching arrangements for lighting devices; Devices for easy attachment to any desired place, e.g. clip, clamp, magnet

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanical connection of the arms of a multi-armed chandelier
Electrical connection of the arms of a multi-armed chandelier
Stands for supporting apparatus or articles in general

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for easy attachment to any desired place, e.g. clip, clamp, magnet

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for fastening or securing constructional elements or machine parts together

definition-item.definition-title: Head fittings

Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

table-column.paragraph-text: Hats or helmets with lamps

definition-item.definition-title: {for portable lighting devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Pendants, arms, or standards; Fixing lighting devices to pendants, arms, or standards (adjustable mounting F21V21/14; construction of posts not peculiar to use with lighting devices E04H12/00)

Access door to the inside of a pole for lighting device; compartments inside the lighting pole

table-column.paragraph-text: Construction of posts not peculiar to use with lighting devices

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjustable mounting of lighting devices

Adjustment clip for a suspended light fixture

Connector for connecting lamp to support
T-channel fixture-mounting pole clamp

Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {for portable lighting devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Portable lighting devices provided with adjustable stands or bases to be used as a movable standing lamp
Documents with this scope, published before 1985, are classified in the higher group F21V21/14

definition-item.definition-title: specially adapted for power operation, e.g. by remote control

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Lighting devices comprising electrical motor to actuate an adjustment movement of the lighting devices

Undercarriages changeable in height or length of legs by telescoping

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Telescopic mountings of a lighting device

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coupling parts adapted for simultaneous co-operation with two or more identical counterparts, e.g. for distributing energy to two or more circuits; Rails or bus-bars constructed so that the counterparts can be connected thereto at any point along their length, e.g. track lighting systems

definition-item.definition-title: Hoisting or lowering devices, e.g. for maintenance

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjustable mountings of lighting devices

definition-item.definition-title: Hand grips

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Operation lamp handles

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handle
handle is defined to grab and/or manipulate/move the lighting device to a chosen position and not as being a handle on which a lighting device is or can be mounted.

definition-item.definition-title: {for operation or dentist lamps}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group, it is desirable to add the Indexing Code F21W2131/202 or F21W2131/205

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangement of electric circuit elements in or on lighting devices {(characterised by cooling arrangements F21V29/508)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric circuits per se

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangement of electronic circuits separated from the light source for vehicle (e.g. mounting of housings for starter circuits for discharge lamps)
Arrangement of electronic circuits part of the light source or light source holder for vehicle (e.g. mounting of housings of starter circuits for discharge lamps)

definition-item.definition-title: the elements being switches (safety devices F21V25/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electric means varying continuously or discontinuously the light intensity, e.g. ON/OFF switch, potentiometer, dimmer,...etc
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices structurally associated with lighting devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Line connectors; Current collectors

definition-item.definition-title: Safety devices structurally associated with lighting devices (gas- tight or water-tight arrangements F21V31/00; in general F16P; protective circuit arrangements per se H02H7/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electromagnetic shielding of the lighting device
Intumescent material associated with lighting device
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gas-tight or water-tight arrangements
Safety devices in general
Protective circuit arrangements per se

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric circuit per se

definition-item.definition-title: Cable-stowing arrangements structurally associated with lighting devices, e.g. reels {(storing lengths of cable in general B65H; the lighting devices being vehicle headlamps F21S41/192; the lighting devices being vehicle lights F21S43/195)}

Power cable winding device for a lighting device

Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of coupling devices of the kinds covered by groups H01R12/70 or H01R24/00- H01R33/00; Means for relieving strain on wire connection, e.g. cord grip

definition-item.definition-title: Protecting lighting devices from thermal damage; Cooling or heating arrangements specially adapted for lighting devices or systems (lighting fixtures combined with outlets for air-treatment systems F24F13/078)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lighting fixtures combined with outlets for air-treatment systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cooling of lighting devices for vehicle headlamps or rear lamps
Cooling of air-treatment systems with air-flow over lighting fixtures
Cooling of projectors or projector type viewers
Cooling arrangements for gas- or vapour-discharge lamps
Cooling arrangements for electric incandescent lamps

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heat pipes
Heating or cooling of liquid crystal cells
Control of the temperature of systems for controlling or regulating non-electric variables
Cooling means for data processing equipment
Arrangements for cooling, heating, ventilating or temperature compensation for semiconductor or other solid state devices
Casings or enclosures with channels or ducts for flow of cooling medium
Thermal arrangements for printed circuits, e.g. for cooling or heating
Heat extraction or cooling elements for semiconductor devices characterised by the semiconductor body packages

definition-item.definition-title: Thermal insulation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Means for screening the heat, e.g. screen for heat radiation
Thermal insulation spaces or air gaps

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of thermal insulation space in figure below:
Ilustrative example of air gap between components or in the mass of a component in the figure below:
Heat insulating material between components to prevent heat conduction in figure below:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Through holes in printed circuit board to screen conductive heat transfer from on one part to the other

definition-item.definition-title: of refractors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Refractors for light sources being designed to facilitate cooling.

definition-item.definition-title: of reflectors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reflectors for light sources being designed to facilitate cooling.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group, see figures below:

definition-item.definition-title: of globes, bowls or cover glasses

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Globes, bowls and cover glasses being designed to facilitate cooling.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Special shape of the lamp cover with means for conducting or dissipating heat, e.g. channels or openings. See illustrative example below:
Thermally conductive films or blades contacting the inner surface of the globe to transfer the heat generated by light source to the globe. See illustrative example below:
Structure of the cover surface facilitating cooling. See illustrative example below:
Globe forming fins or the exterior of which in contact with fins. See illustrative example below:
Evaporation and condensation within the globe of the lighting device or LED module or LED lamp, i.e. part of a globe is forming a part of a heat pipe. See illustrative example below:

definition-item.definition-title: of means for protecting lighting devices from damage, e.g. housings

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for protecting lighting devices from damage, e.g. housings, being designed to facilitate cooling.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Housing for enclosing light source with openings (151) for facilitating cooling:
Cage provided for facilitating cooling:
Evaporation and condensation in a housing compartment:

definition-item.definition-title: of electrical circuits

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for facilitating the cooling of circuit boards for the drivers or supply circuits of the light sources but not the cooling of light emitters or their supports.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Electric circuit is cooled directly by evaporation, see figure below:
Heat transfer from circuit to the housing, see figure below:

definition-item.definition-title: using condensation or evaporation of a fluid, e.g. heat pipes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
by using a heat pipe:
Evaporation and condensation within the globe of the lighting device or LED module:
Evaporation and condensation in a housing compartment for cooling of the central arranged electronic circuit:
Evaporation of water in open environment to improve heat dissipation:

definition-item.definition-title: electrically powered, e.g. refrigeration systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: using thermoelectric means, e.g. Peltier elements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: using liquid coolants (F21V29/51 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The cooling by liquids without condensation or evaporation of the fluid
Below an illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group. In this example the thermally conductive liquid is permanently enclosed within the shell:
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cooling arrangements using condensation or evaporation of a fluid, e.g. heat pipes

definition-item.definition-title: using electrically-powered vibrating means; using ionic wind

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: the gas flowing in a closed circuit

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: {the fans being used for intake}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Fans arranged in such a way that the warm air is moved away from the heat source after the air was heated by the heat source, i.e. the fans are arranged downstream from the light/heat sources in respect of the air flow.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: {the fans being used for discharging}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fans arranged in such a way that they move cooling air in the direction of the heat or light sources, i.e. the fans are located upstream from the light sources in respect of the air the flow.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by passive heat-dissipating elements, e.g. heat-sinks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Heat spreaders, i.e. thermal conducting element interconnecting the source of heat and the heat sink, in order spread the heat on a heat sink surface.
Illustrative example, e.g. a heat spreader for a printed circuit board supporting LEDs:

definition-item.definition-title: {in direct thermal and mechanical contact of each other to form a single system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Heat sinks being built from multiple elements forming a single system where the elements are in direct thermal contact.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: {using split or remote units thermally interconnected, e.g. by thermally conductive bars or heat pipes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Separate heat sink units or split units connected by conductive bars or heat pipes.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: the elements being adjustable with respect to each other, e.g. hinged

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: with fins or blades

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Fins/pins consisting of main fins/pins and supplementary fins/pins increasing the surface areas of the main fins/pins, e.g. snowflake-like profiles or fins with multi-branches.

definition-item.definition-title: {the fins or blades being planar and inclined with respect to the joining surface from which the fins or blades extend}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Fins not radially arranged on a cylinder:
Parallel fins attached to a curved surface, therefore forming an angle with respect to the curved surface:
"V" shaped section fins attached at the tip to a surface:

definition-item.definition-title: {the planes containing the fins or blades having directions perpendicular to the light emitting axis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: with essentially identical diverging planar fins or blades, e.g. with fan-like or star-like cross-section

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: {the planes containing the fins or blades having the direction of the light emitting axis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The direction of fins or blades on the supporting plane are parallel to the axis of the emitted light.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: {the planes containing the fins or blades having directions perpendicular to the light emitting axis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The fins or blades are supported on planes which are perpendicular to the direction of the emitted light, i.e. that the extension of the fins or blades from the supporting plane are parallel to the direction of light.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this group:
Channels formed in the mass of the heat sink
Interconnected fins (124) forming channels (122):

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special materials, e.g. for allowing flexibility, bendability and foldability of a heat exchanger

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices structurally associated with lighting devices
Cable-stowing arrangements structurally associated with lighting devices; cable inlets
Cooling devices
Waterproofing of vehicle headlamps and signal lamps
Casings, cabinets or drawers for electric apparatus; Hermetically-sealed casings

definition-item.definition-title: Provision of filling media

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
LED illuminating device with a transparent epoxy resin filling the shell to sealedly envelope the printed circuit board
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices
Cooling arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: Structural combinations of lighting devices with other articles, not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Lighting devices that are combined with articles having a primary function unrelated to lighting and not otherwise provided for.
The figures below are examples of structural combinations of lighting devices with other articles.

list-item.paragraph-text: The device 20, supported on the flagpole, for properly illuminating a flag during the hours of darkness, is selectively energized so that it directs a beam of light 22 at the flag only during hours of darkness, proper for F21V33/00.

The invention relates to a flag-pole light provided by means of a luminous knob (1) comprising a light source (3) which is provided within a cover (2) and emits light rays that are reflected from reflecting surfaces (4, 5) through a translucent lower portion (2b) of the cover, proper for F21V33/00.

residual-references.section-title: References out of a residual place

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places in relation to which this place is residual:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lights for cultivation in receptacles, forcing frames, greenhouses
Light emitting leads or collars
Illuminating devices for fishing nets
Artificial bait for fishing with light emission
Rods with build-in accessories, e.g. lighting means or measuring devices
Gloves; Protective gloves with luminous or reflective means
Luminous or luminescent artificial flowers, fruit, leaves, or trees
Helmet with lighting devices
Footwear with light sources
Illuminated buckles
Illuminated jewellery
Walking sticks or umbrellas combined with illuminating devices
Purses, bags, luggage or the like combined with illuminating devices
Containers or accessories for handling toilet or cosmetic powder, combined with illuminating means
Illuminated shaving mirrors
Adaptations for incorporating lamps to chairs
Attachments for beds; Lighting, radio, telephone or the like connected to the bedstead
Show cases or show cabinets with lighting devices
Picture frames with illumination
Illuminated underlays for glasses or drinking vessels
Arrangement of illuminating devices on suction cleaners
Medical instruments with illuminating arrangements for examining body cavities or tubes
Dental machines for boring or cutting; Machine parts specially adapted for dentistry; Illuminating devices or attachments
Apparatus for curing resins by radiation in dentistry
Massage adapted for simultaneous treatment with light
Clubs for gymnastics or the like with illuminating devices
Balls with illuminating devices
Roller skates or skate boards with illuminating devices
Toy tops with illuminating arrangements
Toy vehicles with electric lighting systems
Devices on spanners, wrenches or screwdrivers for illuminating the head of the screw or the nut
Hair clippers or dry shavers with means for illuminating the area to be shaved or clipped
Razors with means for illuminating the skin
Typewriters or selective printing machines with illuminating devices for the print
Support for notepads with light emitting devices
Writing implements combined with illuminating devices
Lamps for baking lacquers used in painting or artistic drawing
Arrangements of signalling or lighting devices, the mounting or supporting thereof or circuits thereof for vehicles in general
Railway light signals
Illumination specially adapted for points, form signals or gates for railways
Life-buoys, life-belts, lifejackets or the like characterised by signalling means, e.g. lights
Closures being provided with transient audible or visual signaling means, e.g. illuminating devices

Main component parts of lifts in, or associated with, buildings or other structures; cars and travelling platforms (doors, gates or other apparatus controlling access to or exit from cars; Constructional features, e.g. walls assembly, decorative panels, comfort equipment, thermal or sound insulation; Lighting systems.
Illuminating arrangements for apparatus for transferring liquids from bulk storage containers or reservoirs into vehicles or portable containers
Illuminating devices on locks or keys
Stove illumination
Illumination for oven cavities
Air-treatment or air-conditioning systems with air-flow over lighting fixtures, e.g. for the purpose of using or dissipating the heat therefrom
Night sights with means for illuminating the target
Levels with means for illuminating means for facilitating the observation of the position of the bubble
Magnetic compasses with means for illuminating the compass card or needle
Microscopes with means for illuminating the specimen
Magnifying glasses with means for illuminating object viewed
Optical systems or apparatus with illuminated fiducial marks or measuring scales
Illuminating means for spectacles
Liquid crystal cells associated with illuminating devices
Electrochromic cells associated with illuminating devices
Illuminating scenes for taking photographs
Combinations of cameras with lighting apparatus; Flash units
Traffic lights
Illuminated signs
Illuminated advertising or display means on roads or walls
Illuminated matter for advertising by aircraft
Illuminated matter for advertising on or in specific articles, e.g. ashtrays or letter-boxes
Illuminated switches
Indicating lamps in circuit-breaker switches
Indicating lamps in fuse
Lighting of aerials
Electric coupling devices with built-in light sources
Pulse counter or frequency divider indicators using glow-discharge lamps
Illumination of telephone sets

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Aquaria
Catching insects
Baker's ovens
Show windows or showcases
Radiation therapy
Model railways
Guiding devices for portable power. driven tools
Photographic composing machines
Railway vehicles
Cycles
Ships
Aircraft
Sewing machines
Road surface markings
Road signs
Tents or canopies
Cooling or freezing apparatus
Furnaces, kilns, ovens or retorts
Measuring arrangements
Weighting apparatus
Thermometers
Speedometers
Instruments for measuring
Viewing or reading apparatus
Liquid crystals
Contact photographic printing
Projection photographic printing
Clocks
Time indicated by electric lamps
Time signalling by electric lamps
Visible signalling or calling systems
Actuation of fire alarms
Advertising on ships
Indicating elements or instruments

section-body.paragraph-text: Document classified here has to be forwarded to the field corresponding to the article in which the lighting device is integrated

definition-item.definition-title: {Furniture (hospital beds F21V33/0072)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hospital beds

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for lighting show cases or show cabinets
Arrangements of light sources in shop window

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the Indexing Code F21W2131/301

definition-item.definition-title: {Furnishing for windows and doors (sunshades F21V33/006)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sunshades

definition-item.definition-title: {Household or table equipment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Retrofittable mailbox light system (A47G29/12, A47G29/1212: Mail or newspaper receptacles)

definition-item.definition-title: {Paintings, pictures or photographs; Frames therefor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Picture frames with illumination

definition-item.definition-title: {Table-ware or table equipment, e.g. dishes, cutlery or trays}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illuminated table-ware, spoons, pastry servers
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drinking vessels or saucer used for table service with illumination means

definition-item.definition-title: {Sanitary equipment, e.g. mirrors, showers, toilet seats or paper dispensers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter covered in this group.
Illuminated shower heads
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Small mirrors (hand, pocket, cosmetic or shaving mirrors)
Brushes with additional arrangements
Mirrors for household (also bathroom)
Mirrors for medical purposes (e.g. dentistry)
Rear mirrors for vehicles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nozzles, spray heads or other outlets, with or without auxiliary devices such as valves, heating means

definition-item.definition-title: {Household appliances, e.g. washing machines or vacuum cleaners}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Refrigerators; cold rooms; ice-boxes; cooling or freezing apparatus not covered by any other subclass; lighting arrangement

section-body.paragraph-text: In this , it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of F21W2131/305 for illumination for refrigerators

definition-item.definition-title: {Office articles, e.g. bookmarks, desk lamps with drawers, stands for books or music scores}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of F21W2131/3005 for reading lights attachable to books

definition-item.definition-title: {Audio equipment, e.g. music instruments, radios or speakers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of transducers, loudspeakers or microphones

definition-item.definition-title: {General building constructions or finishing work for buildings, e.g. roofs, gutters, stairs or floors; Garden equipment; Sunshades or parasols}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Stairs with illumination (E04F11/00)
Illuminated tiles (E04F15/00)
Carpets; Stair runners; Bedside rugs; Foot mats (A47G27/02)
Sunshade, patio umbrella
Illuminated handle for door, drawer
Drain gutter with illumination
Illuminated handrail (E04F11/00)
Illuminated window blind assembly (E06B9/386)
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Illuminated umbrella

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: General building constructions; walls; roofs; floors, ceiling, insulations or other protection of buildings
Finishing work on buildings, e.g. stairs, floors
Fixed or movable closures for openings in building, fences, e.g. doors, windows, blinds, gates

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of subclasses F21W2111/08 for illuminated handrails

definition-item.definition-title: {Safety or security signalisation, e.g. smoke or burglar alarms, earthquake detectors; Self-defence devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illumination associated with smoke detector (G08B17/10)
Illumination associated with burglar alarm detector (G08B13/00)
Sighting devices, night sights, e.g. luminescent, combined with light source, e.g. spot-light for illuminating the target, e.g. flash lights or not covered by this group and classified in F41G1/35

definition-item.definition-title: {Leisure, hobby or sport articles, e.g. toys, games or first-aid kits; Hand tools; Toolboxes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illumination for barbecues
Illumination for first aid kits or toolboxes
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for physical training, gymnastics, swimming, climbing or fencing; ball games; training equipment
Skates; skis; roller skates, design or layout or courts, rinks or the like
Toys, e.g. tops, dolls, hoops, building blocks
